{"indexed":{"date-parts":[[2021,5,12]],"date-time":"2021-05-12T05:56:19Z","timestamp":1620798979678},"reference-count":50,"publisher":"Emerald","issue":"3","license":[{"start":{"date-parts":[[2014,9,9]],"date-time":"2014-09-09T00:00:00Z","timestamp":1410220800000},"content-version":"tdm","delay-in-days":0,"URL":"https:\/\/www.emerald.com\/insight\/site-policies"}],"content-domain":{"domain":[],"crossmark-restriction":false},"published-print":{"date-parts":[[2014,9,9]]},"abstract":"\n Purpose<\/jats:title>\n \u2013 Tablets are becoming mainstream devices for digital reading. Through user experience (UX), the purpose of this paper is to identify significant differences between tablet reading systems and other digital reading systems, explore potential requirements for the interactive interface, and propose design solutions so that user\u2019 behavioral intention (BI) may be further enhanced. <\/jats:p>\n <\/jats:sec>\n \n Design\/methodology\/approach<\/jats:title>\n \u2013 First, the authors extracted the context of use and behavior patterns by conducting contextual inquiries; then, potential requirements were identified and design solutions were developed; last, the technology acceptance model was employed to verify research findings. <\/jats:p>\n <\/jats:sec>\n \n Findings<\/jats:title>\n \u2013 The outcome shows that the improved version of the interactive interface is significantly (p<\/jats:italic><0.05) superior to the original version in various aspects, including perceived usefulness, perceived ease of use, user attitude, and BI. <\/jats:p>\n <\/jats:sec>\n \n Originality\/value<\/jats:title>\n \u2013 So far, there has been no relevant research on UX concerning tablet reading systems. Therefore, this study first tried to investigate the primary difference between tablet reading systems and other digital reading systems in context of use and behavior patterns. Then, based on the foregoing discoveries, users\u2019 motivations and perception of tablet readers were probed, and the problems with BI could be solved.<\/jats:p>\n
